definitions: providing shade or protection from direct sunlight through foliage or structure
dishonest, suspicious, or engaged in dubious activities
situated in or characterized by shadows or reduced light
examples: We found a shady spot under the old oak tree
The shady garden provided relief from the summer heat
He made his fortune through shady business deals
The detective investigated several shady characters downtown
The shady side of the street stayed cooler
She preferred the shady corners of the library

definitions: covered with or having long, coarse, and untidy hair or fur
having a rough, untidy appearance suggesting lack of grooming or care
examples: The shaggy dog needed a good grooming session
His shaggy beard made him look like a mountain man
The teenager's shaggy haircut was deliberately messy
Their shaggy lawn hadn't been mowed in weeks

definitions: relating to a test or trial period for new equipment or procedures
examples: The shakedown cruise revealed several mechanical problems
They conducted a shakedown test of the new system
The team went through a shakedown period before opening
This shakedown flight will test all systems

definitions: emotionally upset, disturbed, or shocked by an experience or event
having been moved violently back and forth or up and down
examples: She was visibly shaken after witnessing the accident
The shaken survivors needed immediate counseling
The shaken bottle exploded when he opened it
He drank his martini shaken, not stirred

definitions: trembling or vibrating, especially from weakness, emotion, or instability
nervous, uncertain, or lacking confidence in manner or performance
not firm, reliable, or likely to last; weak in foundation
examples: Her shaky hands made it difficult to write
The old ladder felt shaky under his weight
He gave a shaky performance at his first recital
Her shaky voice betrayed her nervousness
Their shaky alliance lasted only three months
The company's finances rest on shaky ground

definitions: having little depth from top to bottom or from surface to bottom
lacking depth of knowledge, thought, or feeling; superficial
examples: The shallow end of the pool is perfect for children
We waded through the shallow stream carefully
His shallow understanding of politics was obvious
She criticized the book's shallow character development

definitions: not genuine; false, fake, or intended to deceive others
examples: Their sham marriage was only for immigration purposes
The sham company existed only on paper
His sham concern fooled nobody at the meeting
They exposed the sham election as fraudulent

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of shamanism or shamans and their practices
examples: The tribe's shamanistic rituals lasted three days
She studied shamanistic healing practices in Mongolia
The museum displayed various shamanistic artifacts
His shamanistic beliefs influenced his artwork

definitions: made to feel shame, embarrassment, or humiliation about something
examples: The shamed politician resigned from office immediately
She felt shamed by her public mistake
His shamed expression showed genuine remorse
The shamed students apologized to their teacher

definitions: deserving or bringing shame or disgrace; highly embarrassing or dishonorable
examples: His shameful behavior at the party embarrassed everyone
The company's shameful treatment of workers sparked protests
It's shameful how little support veterans receive
Their shameful secret was finally exposed

definitions: showing no shame, embarrassment, or remorse; brazenly bold or immodest
examples: Her shameless self-promotion annoyed her colleagues
The shameless liar continued despite being caught
He made a shameless attempt to take all credit
Their shameless greed destroyed the company

definitions: having a particular form, outline, or configuration
formed, influenced, or determined by particular factors or experiences
examples: The heart-shaped cookies were perfect for Valentine's Day
She wore oddly shaped sunglasses
His views were shaped by early childhood experiences
The policy was shaped by economic concerns

definitions: having significant influence in forming or determining something's development
examples: Education played a shaping role in her career
The shaping forces of history created modern Europe
His shaping influence on jazz is undeniable
These shaping experiences defined her worldview

definitions: used, done, or experienced jointly by two or more people
held in common or experienced mutually by multiple parties
examples: They worked in a shared office space downtown
The shared bathroom was always crowded
Their shared love of music brought them together
We have shared values and common goals

definitions: willing to give, use, or receive something jointly with others
examples: The sharing economy has transformed many industries
Children must learn sharing behavior early
She has a generous sharing nature
Their sharing attitude made collaboration easy

definitions: having a thin cutting edge or fine point capable of cutting or piercing
quick to notice, understand, or respond; mentally acute and perceptive
sudden and marked in degree, clearly defined, or intense
exactly at the stated time without delay or deviation
harsh, critical, or severe in tone, manner, or effect
examples: The sharp knife sliced through the tomato easily
Be careful with those sharp scissors
Her sharp mind quickly solved the complex puzzle
He has sharp business instincts
The car made a sharp turn at the corner
There was a sharp drop in temperature overnight
Please arrive at three o'clock sharp
The meeting starts at noon sharp
His sharp criticism hurt her feelings
She spoke in a sharp tone

definitions: made sharp or sharper by grinding, honing, or other means
examples: The sharpened pencils were ready for the test
His sharpened blade cut through rope easily
Her sharpened senses detected the faint sound
Their sharpened focus improved productivity

definitions: broken suddenly into many small pieces, especially of glass or brittle material
emotionally devastated, shocked, or completely exhausted
examples: The shattered window needed immediate replacement
Shattered glass covered the entire floor
She was shattered by the unexpected news
The shattered parents struggled to cope

definitions: causing something to break suddenly and violently into pieces
causing extreme emotional distress or having devastating impact
examples: The shattering impact destroyed the windshield
The shattering blow cracked the concrete
The shattering news left everyone speechless
It was a shattering defeat for the team

definitions: having had hair removed with a razor or similar tool
reduced by a small amount, especially in time or cost
examples: His freshly shaved face felt smooth
She prefers shaved ice in summer
The shaved seconds made him the winner
They shaved costs by reducing staff

definitions: having been shaved smooth, especially used of facial hair
examples: His clean-shaven appearance impressed the interviewer
The monk's shaven head gleamed in sunlight
He maintained a well-shaven look daily
The shaven areas needed moisturizing

definitions: cut or trimmed with shears or a similar cutting tool
examples: The sheared sheep looked much smaller
Her sheared locks fell to the floor
The sheared metal edges were perfectly straight
Sheared hedges lined the garden path

definitions: enclosed in a sheath, casing, or protective covering
examples: The sheathed sword hung on the wall
The sheathed cables were waterproof
Her legs were sheathed in silk stockings
The building was sheathed in glass panels

definitions: cast off, discarded, or gotten rid of something no longer wanted
examples: The shed pounds made her feel healthier
His shed responsibilities gave him more freedom
The snake's shed skin lay in the terrarium
Shed leaves covered the autumn ground

definitions: so thin as to be transparent or translucent
nothing other than; absolute, complete, or pure
extremely steep, almost perpendicular or vertical
examples: She wore sheer stockings with her dress
The sheer curtains let in soft light
It was sheer luck that saved them
His success was due to sheer determination
The sheer cliff face challenged expert climbers
They stared down the sheer drop

definitions: having a shell or hard outer covering
attacked with artillery shells or subjected to bombardment
examples: The shelled nuts were ready to eat
Shelled creatures dominated the ancient seas
The shelled city showed signs of destruction
The shelled building was completely destroyed

definitions: protected from bad weather or physical harm by a structure or covering
protected from difficult or unpleasant aspects of life
examples: The sheltered cove was perfect for swimming
We found a sheltered spot to have lunch
Her sheltered upbringing hadn't prepared her for city life
The sheltered students were shocked by poverty

definitions: protected from danger, risk, or unpleasant things by a barrier or defense
examples: The shielded cables prevented electromagnetic interference
Workers wore shielded suits for protection
She kept him shielded from harsh realities
The shielded witness testified via video

definitions: continuously moving, changing position, or varying in nature or focus
examples: The shifting sands made walking difficult
Her shifting moods confused everyone
The shifting priorities frustrated the team
Shifting alliances marked the political landscape

definitions: appearing evasive, deceitful, or untrustworthy in manner or appearance
examples: His shifty eyes avoided direct contact
The shifty salesman made us suspicious
She noticed his shifty behavior immediately
The shifty character lurked in shadows

definitions: giving out or reflecting bright light; gleaming or glowing
brilliant, outstanding, or serving as an admirable example
examples: The shining stars lit up the night sky
Her shining hair caught everyone's attention
He was a shining example of dedication
This shining achievement deserves recognition

definitions: having a bright, gleaming surface that reflects light well
examples: The shiny new car attracted many admirers
She polished the silverware until it was shiny
His shiny shoes reflected the overhead lights
The shiny apple looked delicious

definitions: existing, occurring, or used on board a ship
examples: The shipboard romance lasted the entire cruise
Shipboard life requires strict discipline
They enjoyed the shipboard entertainment every evening
Shipboard communications kept them connected

definitions: shaking slightly and uncontrollably, typically from cold, fear, or excitement
examples: The shivering child needed a warm blanket
We found the shivering puppy in the rain
Her shivering voice betrayed her fear
The shivering crowd waited in the snow

definitions: experiencing sudden surprise, dismay, or disgust at something unexpected
suffering from medical shock due to injury or severe distress
examples: The shocked audience gasped at the revelation
She was shocked by his rude behavior
The shocked patient needed immediate medical attention
Shocked victims were treated at the scene

definitions: causing intense surprise, disgust, or offense
extremely bad, unacceptable, or unpleasant in quality
examples: The shocking news spread quickly through town
Her shocking confession stunned the court
The hotel's shocking conditions demanded a refund
His shocking manners embarrassed everyone

definitions: wearing shoes or having shoes of a specified kind
examples: The well-shod hikers tackled the mountain trail
Properly shod feet prevent many injuries
The poorly shod children needed new footwear
All shod visitors must remove their shoes

definitions: badly made or done with inferior materials or workmanship
dishonest, unfair, or showing lack of moral principles
examples: The shoddy construction led to building collapse
They complained about the shoddy merchandise
His shoddy treatment of employees caused resentment
The investigation revealed shoddy business practices

definitions: having had hair, wool, or grass cut or trimmed off
examples: The shorn sheep huddled together for warmth
Her newly shorn head felt strange
The shorn fields awaited new planting
His shorn beard changed his appearance completely

definitions: reduced in length, duration, or extent from the original
examples: The shortened version fit the time slot perfectly
She wore a shortened skirt to the party
Their shortened vacation disappointed the children
The shortened deadline created additional pressure

definitions: relating to or written in a system of rapid writing using symbols
examples: She took shorthand notes during the meeting
The secretary's shorthand skills were impressive
His shorthand notation saved considerable time
Learning shorthand writing requires practice

definitions: exhausted, worn out, or no longer effective
damaged, broken, or ruined beyond repair or usefulness
woven or streaked through with a different color or material
examples: His nerves were completely shot after the ordeal
My shot knees can't handle running anymore
The engine is shot and needs replacement
Their shot reputation never recovered
Her hair was shot through with silver strands
The fabric was shot with gold thread

definitions: having shoulders of a specified type or bearing something on shoulders
examples: The broad-shouldered athlete dominated the game
Square-shouldered jackets were fashionable
The heavily shouldered backpack slowed his pace
Round-shouldered posture indicated fatigue

definitions: expressed or delivered in a loud voice or with great volume
examples: His shouted warnings saved many lives
The shouted instructions were hard to understand
Their shouted conversation disturbed the neighbors
Shouted commands echoed across the field

definitions: making an impressive display intended to attract attention; ostentatious or gaudy
examples: Her showy jewelry dominated her outfit
The showy flowers attracted many bees
His showy car was meant to impress
Their showy wedding cost a fortune

definitions: torn or cut into shreds or small strips
having extremely well-defined muscles with very low body fat
examples: The shredded documents couldn't be reconstructed
She added shredded cheese to the salad
The shredded athlete impressed at the competition
His shredded physique took years to achieve

definitions: having or showing sharp judgment and clever understanding, especially in practical matters
examples: Her shrewd investments made her wealthy
The shrewd businessman never missed an opportunity
His shrewd observations impressed the committee
They made a shrewd decision to sell early

definitions: making a high-pitched, piercing sound that is often unpleasant
examples: Her shrill voice carried across the room
The shrill whistle hurt their ears
The bird's shrill cry warned of danger
His shrill laughter annoyed everyone

definitions: having the characteristics of a shrub; bushy or covered with shrubs
examples: The shrubby plants lined the garden path
This shrubby area provides good wildlife habitat
The shrubby growth needed regular trimming
Their shrubby hedge offered privacy

definitions: having become smaller in size, especially through drying, aging, or disease
examples: His shrunken frame showed the effects of illness
The shrunken sweater no longer fit
The shrunken head was a museum curiosity
Her shrunken savings worried her greatly
